Client#

A asynccore.client is used to send methods to all asynccore.user#

class asynccore.client.Client(api_version, loop=None, logger=True, request_latency=0.1, ratelimit_additional_cooldown=10, use_tasks=False, activity=None, startup_cache=False)[source]#

Bases: HTTPClient

Client supports all services of the asynccore.user. It has methods such as Client.send_message which it calls in all users.

Parameters:

  • api_version (Literal[9, 10]) – version of the discord api used by the client

  • loop (Optional[AbstractEventLoop]) – Set the event loop that will be used by the client

  • logger (bool) – Enable/disable the logger

  • request_latency (float) – Control the rate of requests sent to discord

  • ratelimit_additional_cooldown (float) – Add a cooldown to the ratelimit

  • use_tasks (bool) – Enable or disable the tasks option (asynccore.tasks), which for now is in beta.

  • activity (Optional[ActivityBuilder]) – The argument with type AcivityBuilder is responsible for account activity.

  • startup_cache (bool) – Enable or disable cache fetching at program startup

async for ... in add_reaction(channel_id, message_id, emoji)[source]#

The add_reaction function adds a reaction to the message with the given ID in the channel with the given ID. The emoji parameter is a string that must be an emoticon. Example: 🔥

Parameters:

  • channel_id (int) – Specify which channel_id the message is in

  • message_id (int) – Message ID that you want to add a reaction to

  • emoji (str) – A reaction to add to the message

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

await ban_member(guild_id, user_id)[source]#

The ban_member function is used to ban a member from the guild.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) – Specify the guild that you want to ban a user from

  • user_id (int) – Specify the user that is to be banned

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

async for ... in ban_members(guild_id, user_ids)[source]#

The ban_members function is a coroutine that takes in a guild_id and user_ids list. It then iterates through the users list, popping off the first user id from the user_ids list and passing it to ban_member function of each client. The response from each client is yielded back to whatever called this function.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) – Specify the guild to ban the user from

  • user_ids (list[int]) – Store the list of user ids that will be banned

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

async for ... in create_channel(guild_id, name, channel_type, topic=None, user_limit=None, position=None, nsfw=False)[source]#

The create_channel function creates a channel in the specified guild.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) – Specify the guild id of the server you want to create a channel in

  • name (str) – Specify the name of the channel

  • channel_type (ChannelType) – Specify what type of channel you want to create

  • topic (Optional[str]) – Set the topic of the channel

  • user_limit (Optional[int]) – Set the maximum number of users allowed in a voice channel

  • position (Optional[int]) – Set the position of the channel in the list

  • nsfw (Optional[bool]) – Determine whether the channel is nsfw or not

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

async for ... in create_role(guild_id, name, color=None, hoist=False, permissions=None)[source]#

The create_role function creates a role in the specified guild.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) – Specify the guild in which you want to create a role

  • name (str) – Set the name of the role

  • color (Optional[RGB_COLOR]) – Set the color of the role

  • hoist (Optional[bool]) – Determine whether the role should be displayed separately in the user list

  • permissions (Optional[PermissionBuilder]) – Set the permissions for the role

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

await delete_channel(channel_id)[source]#

The delete_channel function deletes a channel from the server.

Parameters:

channel_id (int) – Specify the channel that is to be deleted

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

async for ... in delete_channels(channel_ids)[source]#

The delete_channels function takes a list of channel_ids and deletes them.

It returns an AsyncIterable of ClientResponse objects, which can be used to check the status code for each request.

Parameters:

channel_ids (list[int]) – Specify the list of channel ids that will be deleted

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

await delete_message(channel_id, message_id)[source]#

The delete_message function deletes a message from the specified channel.

Parameters:

  • channel_id (int) – Specify the channel id of the message to be deleted

  • message_id (int) – Identify the message that is to be deleted

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

await delete_reaction(channel_id, message_id, user_id, emoji)[source]#

The delete_reaction function is used to delete a reaction from a message.

Parameters:

  • channel_id (int) – Specify the channel where the message is located

  • message_id (int) – Identify the message that you want to delete a reaction from

  • user_id (int) – Specify the user whose reaction is to be deleted

  • emoji (str) – Specify the emoji to be deleted

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

await delete_role(guild_id, role_id)[source]#

The delete_role function deletes a role from the guild.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) – int: Specify the guild that you want to delete a role from

  • role_id (int) – int: Specify the role_id to be deleted

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

async for ... in delete_roles(guild_id, role_ids)[source]#

delete_roles function removes all roles with id in the list

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) – Specify the guild that the roles are being deleted from

  • role_ids (list[int]) – Specify the roles that are to be deleted

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

await edit_member(guild_id, user_id, nickname=None, add_roles=None, remove_roles=None)[source]#

The edit_member function allows you to edit a member of a guild.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) – Specify the guild that you want to edit a member in

  • user_id (int) – Specify the user that you want to edit

  • nickname (Optional[str]) – Change the nickname of a user in a guild

  • add_roles (Optional[list[int]]) – Add roles to a user

  • remove_roles (Optional[list[int]]) – Remove roles from a user

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

await edit_message(channel_id, message_id, message_content)[source]#

The edit_message function allows you to edit a message.

Parameters:

  • channel_id (int) – Specify the channel id of the message you want to edit

  • message_id (int) – id the message to edit

  • message_content (str) – Edit the message content

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

await get_channel(channel_id)[source]#

The get_channel function is used to get a channel object from the guild.

Parameters:

channel_id (int) – Specify the channel id of the channel you want to get

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

async for ... in get_channels(guild_id)[source]#

The get_channels function is a coroutine that takes in a guild_id and returns an AsyncIterable of ClientResponse objects.

The function can return the data of all channels on the server

Parameters:

guild_id (int) – Specify the guild id of the server you want to get channels from

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

await get_guild(guild_id)[source]#

The get_guild function is used to get information about a guild.

Parameters:

guild_id (int) – Specify the id of the guild you want to get information about

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

await get_guild_bans(guild_id)[source]#

The get_guild_bans function returns a list of banned users in the guild.

Parameters:

guild_id (int) – Specify the guild id of the server you want to get banned users from

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

async for ... in get_guild_invites(guild_id)[source]#

The get_guild_invites function returns a list of invite objects. Requires the ‘MANAGE_GUILD’ permission.

Parameters:

guild_id (int) – Get the invites for a specific guild

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

await get_member(guild_id, user_id)[source]#

The get_member function is used to get a member from the guild.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) – Specify the guild that you want to get a member from

  • user_id (int) – Specify the user id of the member you want to get

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

async for ... in get_message(channel_id, message_id)[source]#

The get_message function is used to get a message from a channel.

Parameters:

  • channel_id (int) – Specify the channel id of the message you want to get

  • message_id (int) – Get the message around that id

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

await get_messages(channel_id, limit=100)[source]#

The get_messages function is used to retrieve a list of message objects from the channel.

Parameters:

  • channel_id (int) – Specify which channel to get the messages from

  • limit (int) – Limit the number of messages returned

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

await get_reactions(channel_id, message_id, emoji)[source]#

The get_reactions function returns a ClientResponse with list of users that reacted with the specified emoji.

Parameters:

  • channel_id (int) – Identify the channel that contains the message

  • message_id (int) – Identify the message that is being reacted to

  • emoji (str) – Specify the emoji to get reactions for

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

async for ... in get_roles(guild_id)[source]#

get_roles returns a list of data with all the roles on the server

Parameters:

guild_id (int) – Specify the guild id of the server you want to get roles from

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

await kick_member(guild_id, user_id)[source]#

The kick_member function kicks a member from the guild.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) – Specify the guild that you want to kick a user from

  • user_id (int) – Identify the user to be kicked

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

async for ... in kick_members(guild_id, user_ids)[source]#

The kick_members function is a coroutine that takes in a guild_id and user_ids list. It then iterates through the users list, popping off the first user id from the user_ids list and kicking them from the specified guild. It yields each response as it goes.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) – Specify which guild the user is in

  • user_ids (list[int]) – list with id of people to kick out

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

login(tokens)[source]#

The login function is used to check the provided tokens.

Parameters:

tokens (Union[str, list[str]]) – tokens to check

Return type:

None

async for ... in reply_message(channel_id, message_id, message_content, mention_author=True)[source]#

The reply_message function is used to reply to a message in a channel.

Parameters:

  • channel_id (int) – Specify the channel to send the message in

  • message_id (int) – Reply to a specific message

  • message_content (str) – Message content

  • mention_author (bool) – Determine whether or not the author of the message should be mentioned in

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

async for ... in send_dm_message(user_id, message_content)[source]#

The send_dm_message function sends a direct message to the user with the given user_id.

Parameters:

  • user_id (int) – Specify the user id of the person you want to send a message to

  • message_content (str) – Specify the message content

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[Optional[ClientResponse]]]

async for ... in send_message(channel_id, message_content)[source]#

The send_message function sends a message to the specified channel.

Parameters:

  • channel_id (int) – Specify the channel to send the message to

  • message_content (str) – content of the message

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

await unban_member(guild_id, user_id)[source]#

The unban_member function unban a user from the guild.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) – Specify the guild that you want to unban a member from

  • user_id (int) – Specify the user id of the member to unban

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

async for ... in unban_members(guild_id, user_ids)[source]#

The unban_members function is a coroutine that takes in a guild_id and user_ids list. It then iterates through the users list, popping off the first user id from the user_ids list and passing it to unban_member function of each client. If there is no response or if there was an error, it will return None. Otherwise, it will yield back the response.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) – Specify the guild id of the server you want to unban members from

  • user_ids (list[int]) – Store the list of user ids to unban

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]
